column1: The young page was strongly and sturdily built. His garb was an English one
column2: but with some admixture of Norman fashions. He wore tightly-fitting leg coverings
column3: a garment somewhat resembling a blouse of blue cloth girded in by a belt at the waist
column4: and falling in folds to the knee. Over his shoulders hung a short mantle of orange colour with a hood. On his head was a cap with a wide brim that was turned up closely behind
column5: and projected in a pointed shovel shape in front. In his belt was a small dagger. He wore shoes of light yellow leather fastened by bands over the insteps. As he ran down the steps of the palace he came into sharp contact with another page who had just turned the corner of the street."I crave your pardon
column7: he said hurriedly, but I was in haste and saw you not."
